subject: Productivity
title: The Avoider
description: Learn The Avoider in one minute.

hook.text: The avoider doesn't fear the deadline. They fear being judged for what they produce.

buildup.text: Avoiders procrastinate to protect their self-image. Not trying feels safer than trying and failing.

discovery.text: This type is closely linked to imposter syndrome. Success feels accidental; failure feels inevitable.

twist.text: Avoiders often appear confident. The procrastination happens in private, hidden behind busy schedules.

climax.text: Exposing the fear, not fighting the delay, is the path forward for this type.

punchline.text: Avoiders don't fear work. They fear judgment.

quiz.question: What drives the avoider type of procrastinator?
options: Fear of being judged for their work
A desire to rebel against authority
